Articles.Content:
Add a custom flags interface. For KSP 1, I (and I know of others) would make a basic mod just to add custom flags. It would  be awesome to have a way to import flags. 

Summary:

Find a image file, and then it becomes a flag

 

Detailed:

Add a button beside the choose a flag menu, to import a flag. Have it open the file chooser tool, so that you can find your image. When you find you image, it is displayed in game, and you can edit its aspect ratio. Aspect ratios  that aren't default are achieved by making the flags upper pole a different length.
Or you just do it like in ksp1
KSP1 was literally "put the png image into the flag folder". I expect the same in the sequel.

It wouldn't be a bad thing for KSP 2 to have an ingame alternative to having to mess around with Windows Explorer tabs and having to reload the game to see your flag show up.

Edited February 22, 2023 by Bej Kerman

Oh god no, not windows explorer!!?!

Now hot loading the flag so you dont have to restart would be welcome, but id rather have the devs focused on about a million things other than image editing.

Seems like a web page on kerbalspaceprogram.com would be a no brainer tho. Upload an image, crop it with tge right fixed ratio, resize and download. Should be a no brainer for any paid webmaster.
Mspaint.exe doesn't even require uploading and downloading, and you can easily resize and crop a picture.
True, but a "KSP flag maker" page would be easier. (Is mspaint still a thing? LOL)
Always has been, it never left.
